update.description:
Sample world with [Urban tiles](https://app.ignitionrobotics.org/search;q=Urban). Since this is a proof of concept for the Urban pieces, the structure is just slightly modified from a previous Tunnel qualifier world.

`tile_tsv.py` from tunnel circuits is updated to generate urban world from `urban.tsv`. Urban tiles need to be scaled by 40. Tunnel tiles were scaled by 20.

```
python3 tile_tsv.py urban.tsv --world-name urban --scale_x 40 --scale_y 40 --x0 -10 --y0 240 > urban_standalone.sdf
```

Things that need to be fixed outside this PR:

* Straight tile’s color \(gray\) is darker than the other tiles \(green\).
* Subway station doesn’t have textures. `Plant_Albedo.png` is missing, indicated by this error:  
  `[Err] [Material.cc:143] Unable to find texture[Plant_Albedo.png] in path[/home/developer/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/Urban Station/1//meshes]`

The world can be inspected by:

```
cd subt/subt_ign/worlds
ign launch ../launch/urban.ign
ign launch ../launch/team.ign
ign topic -t "/model/x1/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.0}"
```

To see the full tunnel, set `<levels>false</levels>` in `urban.ign`.

‌
update.title: New urban world
update.reason: This obsolete.  New ones will be created in private repo for qual and for Simple and Practice worlds here.

update.title: New urban world

content.raw: I just talked to @{5b6a0f313df2033d0d9a151a} about the gaps. It looks like the urban tunnel models on fuel are using the non-PBR version of the meshes. We should replace them with the PBR version first and see if the gaps still exist. If they are, which is quite likely, then Cole will go ahead and update the PBR meshes.
content.html: I just talked to @Cole Biesemeyer about the gaps. It looks like the urban tunnel models on fuel are using the non-PBR version of the meshes. We should replace them with the PBR version first and see if the gaps still exist. If they are, which is quite likely, then Cole will go ahead and update the PBR meshes.

update.title: New urban world

update.description:
Sample world with [Urban tiles](https://app.ignitionrobotics.org/search;q=Urban). Since this is a proof of concept for the Urban pieces, the structure is just slightly modified from a previous Tunnel qualifier world.

`tile_tsv.py` from `gazebo9` branch is updated to generate urban world from `urban.tsv` \(Urban tiles need to be scaled by 40. Tunnel tiles were scaled by 20\):

```
python3 tile_tsv.py urban.tsv --world-name urban --scale_x 40 --scale_y 40 --x0 30 --y0 240 > urban_standalone.sdf
```

Some manual work is eliminated by

* Defining tile URLs in `types_to_path.yaml`
* Automatically generating levels, with box size and buffer defined by `--levels_sx`, `--levels_sy`, `--levels_sz`, and `--levels_buf`. This is a rough generation so that the human work doesn’t have to start from scratch. The exact definitions probably still need manual tweaking.

Things that need to be fixed outside this PR:

* Straight tile’s color \(gray\) is darker than the other tiles \(green\).
* Subway station doesn’t have textures. `Plant_Albedo.png` is missing, indicated by this error:  
  `[Err] [Material.cc:143] Unable to find texture[Plant_Albedo.png] in path[/home/developer/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/Urban Station/1//meshes]`
* \(Outdated\) ~~Before can test levels, in both the new world and the tunnel qualifier world, I am not able to make levels appear by moving the robot. Robot moves forward and falls off the edge without activating the levels:~~  
  `ign topic -t "/model/x1/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.0}"`

The world can be inspected by:

```
cd subt/subt_ign/worlds
ign launch ../launch/urban.ign
ign launch ../launch/team.ign
ign topic -t "/model/x1/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.0}"
```

\(Outdated\) ~~Because of the levels issue above, temporarily the full world can be inspected by a standalone file:~~

```
cd subt/subt_ign/worlds
ign gazebo urban_standalone.sdf -r
```

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3662834529-Screenshot%20from%202019-09-16%2020-21-37.png)
![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/1627023660-Screenshot%20from%202019-09-16%2014-40-01.png)
‌

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3355615402-Screenshot%20from%202019-09-16%2014-41-05.png)
‌

`tile_tsv.py` from `gazebo9` branch is updated to generate urban world from `urban.tsv` \(Urban tiles need to be scaled by 40. Tunnel tiles were scaled by 20\):

```
python3 tile_tsv.py urban.tsv --world-name urban --scale_x 40 --scale_y 40 --x0 30 --y0 240 > urban_standalone.sdf
```

Some manual work is eliminated by

* Defining tile URLs in `types_to_path.yaml`
* Automatically generating levels, with box size and buffer defined by `--levels_sx`, `--levels_sy`, `--levels_sz`, and `--levels_buf`. This is a rough generation so that the human work doesn’t have to start from scratch. The exact definitions probably still need manual tweaking.

Things that need to be fixed outside this PR:

* Straight tile’s color \(gray\) is darker than the other tiles \(green\).
* Texture `Plant_Albedo.png` is missing, indicated by this error with Urban Station tile:  
  `[Err] [Material.cc:143] Unable to find texture[Plant_Albedo.png] in path[/home/developer/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/Urban Station/1//meshes]`
* Subway station doesn’t have textures
* \(Outdated\) ~~Before can test levels, in both the new world and the tunnel qualifier world, I am not able to make levels appear by moving the robot. Robot moves forward and falls off the edge without activating the levels:~~  
  `ign topic -t "/model/x1/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.0}"`

The world can be inspected by:

```
cd subt/subt_ign/worlds
ign launch ../launch/urban.ign
ign launch ../launch/team.ign
ign topic -t "/model/x1/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.0}"
```

\(Outdated\) ~~Because of the levels issue above, temporarily the full world can be inspected by a standalone file:~~

```
cd subt/subt_ign/worlds
ign gazebo urban_standalone.sdf -r
```

![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/1456414945-Screenshot%20from%202019-09-16%2014-34-37.png)
![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/1627023660-Screenshot%20from%202019-09-16%2014-40-01.png)
![](https://bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/3355615402-Screenshot%20from%202019-09-16%2014-41-05.png)
‌
update.title: New urban world

update.description:
World with urban tiles.

`tile_tsv.py` from `gazebo9` branch is updated to generate urban world from `urban.tsv`:

```
python3 tile_tsv.py urban.tsv --world-name urban --scale_x 40 --scale_y 40 --x0 30 --y0 240 > urban_standalone.sdf
```

Some manual work is eliminated by

* Defining tile URLs in `types_to_path.yaml`
* Automatically generating levels, with box size and buffer defined by `--levels_sx`, `--levels_sy`, `--levels_sz`, and `--levels_buf`. This is a rough generation so that the human work doesn’t have to start from scratch. The exact definitions probably still need manual tweaking.

Things that need to be fixed outside this PR:

* Straight tile’s color \(gray\) is darker than the other tiles \(green\).
* Texture `Plant_Albedo.png` is missing, indicated by this error with Urban Station tile:  
  `[Err] [Material.cc:143] Unable to find texture[Plant_Albedo.png] in path[/home/developer/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/Urban Station/1//meshes]`
* Before can test levels, in both the new world and the tunnel qualifier world, I am not able to make levels appear by moving the robot. Robot moves forward and falls off the edge without activating the levels:  
  `ign topic -t "/model/x1/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.0}"`

The world can be inspected by:

```
cd subt/subt_ign/worlds
ign launch ../launch/urban.ign
ign launch ../launch/team.ign
ign topic -t "/model/x1/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.0}"
```

Because of the levels issue above, temporarily the full world can be inspected by a standalone file:

```
cd subt/subt_ign/worlds
ign gazebo urban_standalone.sdf -r
```

update.title: New urban world

content.raw:
I will wait for PR #149. It will simplify the artifact placement in the .tsv and saves the manual adjustment in the generated .sdf.

Scaling to 40 does not resolve the gap problem though.
content.html:
I will wait for PR #149. It will simplify the artifact placement in the .tsv and saves the manual adjustment in the generated .sdf.

Scaling to 40 does not resolve the gap problem though.

content.raw: Got word from Cole that the tiles are supposed to be 40 m x 40 m. I’ll need to change the scale of the tiles and the tsv.
content.html: Got word from Cole that the tiles are supposed to be 40 m x 40 m. I’ll need to change the scale of the tiles and the tsv.

content.raw: Yeah, I didn’t think about that. The intention of the function was just a quick way to start putting things into the levels plugin, without having to manually look at each tile’s position and name and calculating the bounding box position. Some manual adjustment is going to be needed. It’s just less work than starting the manual work from scratch.
content.html: Yeah, I didn’t think about that. The intention of the function was just a quick way to start putting things into the levels plugin, without having to manually look at each tile’s position and name and calculating the bounding box position. Some manual adjustment is going to be needed. It’s just less work than starting the manual work from scratch.

content.raw: I'm not sure the assumption that all levels have the same size would work in all cases. A long tunnel larger than this level size could end up in two different levels even though a performer can see all the way to the end of the tunnel.
content.html: I'm not sure the assumption that all levels have the same size would work in all cases. A long tunnel larger than this level size could end up in two different levels even though a performer can see all the way to the end of the tunnel.

content.raw:
I'm not sure why. It looks like the gap is ~0.016 m, in that if I shift a tile by 0.016, it closes the gap. I thought it might be related to the scale parameter passed to `tile_tsv.py`, but looking at tunnel world in gazebo9 branch, the tunnel world was generated with the default scaling \(--scale\_x 20 --scale\_y 20\), which is the same for the urban world.  
Maybe it has to do with the actual scaling of the meshes? I did notice that the tiles might be twice as large as the tunnel tiles, because the tiles had to be specified every other cell in the `.tsv` file in order to not overlap 50% in the generated `.sdf`.  
I tried setting the scale to 10, but that made the tiles overlap a lot that the world is unusable.  
I also tried removing the every other empty row and column, to see if the empty rows and columns were the cause of the gaps, and scaled to 40. The gaps persisted. So it might be the meshes?
content.html:
I'm not sure why. It looks like the gap is ~0.016 m, in that if I shift a tile by 0.016, it closes the gap. I thought it might be related to the scale parameter passed to tile_tsv.py, but looking at tunnel world in gazebo9 branch, the tunnel world was generated with the default scaling (--scale_x 20 --scale_y 20), which is the same for the urban world.
Maybe it has to do with the actual scaling of the meshes? I did notice that the tiles might be twice as large as the tunnel tiles, because the tiles had to be specified every other cell in the .tsv file in order to not overlap 50% in the generated .sdf.
I tried setting the scale to 10, but that made the tiles overlap a lot that the world is unusable.
I also tried removing the every other empty row and column, to see if the empty rows and columns were the cause of the gaps, and scaled to 40. The gaps persisted. So it might be the meshes?

content.raw:
It looks like there are slight seams in the tunnel segments. Do you know if this is due to placement of the tunnel segments, or if the meshes need to be fixed?

![urban.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8ze6Mjd/images/2666175184-urban.png)
content.html: It looks like there are slight seams in the tunnel segments. Do you know if this is due to placement of the tunnel segments, or if the meshes need to be fixed?

update.description:
World with urban tiles.

`tile_tsv.py` from `gazebo9` branch is updated to generate urban world from `urban.tsv`.

Some manual work is eliminated by

* defining tile URLs in `types_to_path.yaml`
* automatically generating levels, with box size and buffer defined by `--levels_sx`, `--levels_sy`, `--levels_sz`, and `--levels_buf`.

Things that need to be fixed outside this PR:

* Straight tile’s color \(gray\) is darker than the other tiles \(green\).
* Texture `Plant_Albedo.png` is missing, indicated by this error with Urban Station tile:  
  `[Err] [Material.cc:143] Unable to find texture[Plant_Albedo.png] in path[/home/developer/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/openrobotics/models/Urban Station/1//meshes]`
* Before can test levels, in both the new world and the tunnel qualifier world, I am not able to make levels appear by moving the robot. Robot moves forward and falls off the edge without activating the levels:  
  `ign topic -t "/model/x1/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.0}"`

The world can be inspected by:

```
cd subt/subt_ign/worlds
ign launch ../launch/urban.ign
ign launch ../launch/team.ign
ign topic -t "/model/x1/cmd_vel" -m ignition.msgs.Twist -p "linear: {x: 2.0}"
```

Because of the levels issue above, temporarily the full world can be inspected by a standalone file:

```
cd subt/subt_ign/worlds
ign gazebo urban_standalone.sdf -r
```
